content.description: <math alttext="C O gas plus 2 H 2 gas is in equilibrium with C H 3 O H gas. K equals 2.2 times 10 to the 4 power at 298 kelvins" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>OH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="3.0em"></mspace><mi>K</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.2</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>at</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: A stoichiometric mixture of <math alttext="C O gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> was allowed to react in two different <math alttext="2.0 liters" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>L</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> rigid containers at a constant temperature of <math alttext="298 kelvins" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>298</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The reaction is represented by the equation above. Diagram 1 represents the uncatalyzed reaction and diagram 2 represents the catalyzed reaction one hour after the reactants were mixed. Which of the following correctly explains the experimental results represented in the particle diagrams?

choices.label: Although the reaction is thermodynamically favorable because <math alttext="delta G naught is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> based on the value of <math alttext="K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, only the catalyzed reaction could proceed in one hour because its reactant molecules had a higher average kinetic energy.

Although the reaction is thermodynamically favorable because <math alttext="delta G naught is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> based on the value of <math alttext="K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, only the catalyzed reaction could proceed in one hour because it has a lower activation-energy reaction pathway.

The reaction is not thermodynamically favorable because <math alttext="delta G naught is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> based on the value of <math alttext="K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, but the addition of a catalyst improved the orientation of the reactants during collisions, allowing the catalyzed reaction to proceed in one hour.

The reaction is not thermodynamically favorable because <math alttext="delta G naught is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> based on the value of <math alttext="K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, but the catalyzed reaction could proceed in one hour because it has a lower <math alttext="delta H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and a higher <math alttext="delta S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Although the reaction is thermodynamically favorable because <math alttext="delta G naught is less than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi><mo><</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> based on the value of <math alttext="K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, only the catalyzed reaction could proceed in one hour because it has a lower activation-energy reaction pathway.

skill.text: 6.E: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using connections between particulate and macroscopic scales or levels.
